title: Heroes of the Storm fans are excited: More than a year after ...
originBody: Skip to main content THE GLOBAL AUTHORITY ON PC GAMES SUBSCRIBE US Edition News Reviews Hardware Best Of Magazine The Top 100 Forum More POPULAR CS2 Diablo 4 Top 100 Starfield Cities: Skylines 2 When you purchase through links on our site, we may earn an affiliate commission. Here‚Äôs how it works. News MOBA Heroes Of The Storm Heroes of the Storm fans are excited: More than a year after Blizzard ended development, a new patch has appeared on the PTR By Andy Chalk published 6 days ago There's no new content in the surprise new HotS update, but it fixes an awful lot of bugs. COMMENTS (Image credit: Blizzard) More than a year after Blizzard did an Old Yeller to Heroes of the Storm‚Äî"the only good MOBA" in the eyes of our weekend editor Jody Macgregor‚Äîa new patch has appeared on the public test realm, and it's got some fans hopeful for more to come. The patch is a beefy one, but entirely a fixer-upper: There are some UI changes, a handful of balance tweaks, and a big pile of bug fixes. Blizzard thanked players "for providing insight and feedback for these changes," and asked that anyone who runs into a bug during PTR testing report them on the appropriate forum. The new update is in keeping with what Blizzard committed to when it formally ended Heroes of the Storm development. "Moving forward we will support Heroes in a manner similar to our other longstanding games, StarCraft and StarCraft II", it said at the time. "In the future, we'll continue seasonal rolls and hero rotations, and while the in-game shop will remain operational there are no plans for new for-purchase content to be added. Future patches will primarily focus on client sustainability and bug fixing, with balance updates coming as needed." Sponsored Links Play this game for 1 minute and see why everyone is addicted. Raid Shadow Legends Despite that, there is hope born anew amongst the diehard fanbase, fuelled not just by the surprise arrival of a new patch but also Microsoft's acquisition of Activision Blizzard. Microsoft Gaming CEO Phil Spencer has previously expressed enthusiasm for reviving some of the company's old classics, and there's hope that Heroes of the Storm will be among them. RECOMMENDED VIDEOS FOR YOU... "I hope they peep over to [StarCraft 2] and realize Blizz nerds are a hardy bunch and can survive content droughts and flourish with a drop of content," redditor fourtyonexx wrote. "Also give us arcade mode wtf, HotS runs off of the SC2 engine, so it‚Äôs easy to just give us arcade mode smhhhhh." "I hope they are like 'League of Legends, Dota2....we have our own MOBA too, lets start that back up'," GrumpyKitten514 added. "HOTS is/was one of my favorite games to play. I might just reinstall it." Similar sentiments are being shared on Blizzard's own Heroes of the Storm forums. "That‚Äôs A LOT of fixes for a game that‚Äôs in maintenance mode," Ephemiel wrote. "It‚Äôs absolutely getting re-launched somewhere, perhaps Steam since they already added Overwatch 2 and Diablo 4." And of course there's a meme: (Image credit: Gardomirror (Reddit)) Now, I don't want to be the guy to crush a dream, and anything is possible, especially with Microsoft now calling the shots. But I think it's a very long shot indeed: Heroes of the Storm fans are obviously dedicated but they're also, with all due respect, small in number‚Äîand as GrumpyKitten514 indirectly noted, the MOBA genre is already dominated by LoL and Dota. There's very little space for Heroes of the Storm to muscle into, even if active development resumed. So, could Heroes of the Storm suddenly spring back to full and vigorous life? Sure, absolutely. But will it? Sorry to say, folk, but no, I don't think so. The full Heroes of the Storm patch notes are up at blizzard.com. Andy Chalk Andy has been gaming on PCs from the very beginning, starting as a youngster with text adventures and primitive action games on a cassette-based TRS80. From there he graduated to the glory days of Sierra Online adventures and Microprose sims, ran a local BBS, learned how to build PCs, and developed a longstanding love of RPGs, immersive sims, and shooters. He began writing videogame news in 2007 for The Escapist and somehow managed to avoid getting fired until 2014, when he joined the storied ranks of PC Gamer. He covers all aspects of the industry, from new game announcements and patch notes to legal disputes, Twitch beefs, esports, and Henry Cavill. Lots of Henry Cavill. originSummary: More than a year after Blizzard halted development on "Heroes of the Storm", a new patch aimed at fixing existing issues has emerged on the public test realm, sparking hopes for more updates amongst fans.
While no new content has been introduced in the patch, the game's fans are optimistic about a potential revamp, especially following Microsoft's acquisition of Activision Blizzard.

However, the article suggests that a significant game update is unlikely due to the game's smaller fan base and the dominance of the MOBA (Multiplayer Online Battle Arena) genre by larger games like "League of Legends" and "Dota 2".
commentSummary: The Indian government is contemplating a partnership with the U.S. to acquire 80-100 Predator C Avenger aircraft, which would enhance India's defence capabilities.
The potential acquisition includes armed drone systems along with advanced surveillance technology, boosting India's spying and attack potential.

This strategy is in response to escalating tensions with China over territorial disputes in the Himalayas, with India preparing armaments for these stealthy, jet-powered drones with precision-guided bombs and missiles.

title: How to Rate Games on IGN
originBody: Nordic Home Reviews Videos Features News Previews Movies & TV More HOME More About IGN Nordic Contact Advertise Press Privacy Policy User agreement Cookies RSS IGN Nordic is operated under license by eMense Change Region United States United Kingdom Australia Africa Adria Benelux / Dutch Brazil China / ‰∏≠ÂõΩ Czechia / Slovakia France Germany Greece / ŒïŒªŒªŒ¨Œ¥Œ± Hungary India Israel Italy / Italia Japan / Êó•Êú¨ Korea / ÌïúÍµ≠ Latin America Middle East - English Middle East - ÿßŸÑÿ£Ÿàÿ≥ÿ∑ÿßŸÑÿ¥ÿ±ŸÇ Nordic Poland Portugal Southeast Asia Spain / Espa√±a Turkey / T√ºrkiye world.ign.com Login Register BALDUR'S GATE III How to Rate Games on IGN Submit your own scores. + BY JOHN DAVISON Posted Oct. 31, 2023, 10:55 p.m. While it‚Äôs not quite over yet, 2023 has certainly been an incredible year for game releases. Whether we look back on it as one of the greatest years in gaming history remains to be seen, but there‚Äôs a good chance we‚Äôll be talking about The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom, Baldur‚Äôs Gate 3, Metroid Prime Remastered, Alan Wake 2, Diablo IV, Street Fighter 6, and the Resident Evil 4 remake for years to come. We‚Äôve given four games a 10 this year, and a further 27 have received a nine, so that puts it up there alongside great moments like 2004 (Halo 2, Half-Life 2, Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater, GTA: San Andreas) or 1998 (The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time, Half-Life, Starcraft, Resident Evil 2, Metal Gear Solid). You may not always agree with our reviews (believe me, I'm aware of this), so some additional perspective from other players can be useful. Earlier this year we rolled out a way for you to add your scores to the games in our database alongside our own as another element to help provide as much guidance as we can. You may not always agree with our reviews (believe me, I'm aware of this), so some additional perspective from other players can be useful. If you‚Äôre signed-in as a registered IGN user, when you go to any of our game pages ‚Äì like, say, Baldur‚Äôs Gate 3 ‚Äì you can hit the ‚ÄúRate Game‚Äù button and there‚Äôs then a very quick multi-part process that you can zip through on either your phone or desktop. As you can see in the screenshots below, the most important part comes first: simply give the game a rating on a scale of 1-10. If you‚Äôre managing your game collection through IGN Playlist the next tab will ask you to enter what platform you played it on. If you‚Äôre new to Playlist, it‚Äôll pause here briefly and ask you what your current status with the game is. Are you actively playing it? Are you taking a break? Did you beat it? Or have you quit? (No one ever seems to pick that last option. Never surrender, right?) Then the system will ask you to give a thumbs up or down to specific aspects of the game ‚Äì do you think the characters are great? Do you like the graphics? Does the balance suck? You don‚Äôt have to answer all of these, just give a thumbs up or down to the elements of the game that really stood out to you either positively or negatively. Finally, if you want to write up a brief review you can enter up to 2,000 characters sharing your thoughts on the game, but you can leave this blank if you don‚Äôt have anything further to say. Hit ‚Äúnext‚Äù from here, and it‚Äôll give you a preview of your choices and then you can post. Once you‚Äôve submitted your review, it contributes to a few areas of IGN. First, all user reviews aggregate up to the main game page so it‚Äôll appear in the main infobox there. Potentially (and hopefully, eventually) every game in our database could have an audience score. Secondly, for the really good stuff, these scores also drive our Icon Awards list, which is an entirely user-review driven greatest games of all time list. The greater the volume of high user scores a game receives, the further it moves up the list. Currently the top of this list is dominated by Zelda. The number one game is The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom, followed by Red Dead Redemption 2, The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time, Persona 5: Royal, and then The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild. If, like me, you‚Äôre grazing through that list and wondering where Baldur‚Äôs Gate 3 is, or why my beloved Elder Scrolls: Skyrim is somehow only number 30, then the best course of action is to rate the games that you really love. Our goal with all of this stuff stems from our belief in the value of reviews as broad guidance for helping people choose what to play. Our hope for our game reviews is that they provide as much context as possible so you have plenty to go on. This includes ensuring our video reviews have as much illustrative gameplay footage as possible, that our screenshots show you exactly what the game looks like, and that we provide performance reviews where we can to show how things run on different hardware. We also try to ensure that we‚Äôre as transparent as possible about our review process, and that includes regular updates from our director of reviews, Dan Stapleton, about the challenges reviewers face. Since we launched IGN Playlist last year, we also include embedded lists to provide additional context about both the franchise the game is from (like where Super Mario Wonder fits into the bigger picture of Mario games) or the reviewer‚Äôs specific tastes (lists of their favorite games, or favorites within the genre of the reviewed game) so you can get a feel for what makes them tick. If you‚Äôve not seen a Playlist before, I‚Äôve embedded one below of all our best-reviewed games this year as an example. Supplementing all of this with a tool where you can share your scores and opinions on games too provides another important piece of context that we can include as part of our database, and incorporate into our other content. Maybe you can use this Playlist as a jumping off point to review some games. John Davison is IGN's publisher and editorial lead, and has been writing about games and entertainment for more than 30 years. He really does like Skyrim quite a lot. When you buy something from this article, IGN Nordic might get a part of the revenue. originSummary: IGN Nordic has announced key 2023 game releases, including The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom, Baldur‚Äôs Gate 3, Metroid Prime Remastered, Alan Wake 2, Diablo IV, Street Fighter 6, and the Resident Evil 4 remake.
They have implemented a feature that allows registered users to score games, this can shape aggregate user scores and possibly impact IGN's Icon Awards list, a ranking driven by user reviews.
IGN also reaffirmed its pledge to providing transparent reviews to assist users in game selection.

title: 10 Retro Games With Vibrant Competitive Communities
originBody: Newsletter Log in Trending Exclusives Dynamic Duos Podcast Ahsoka Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom Loki The Marvels Marvel's Spider-Man 2 FRANCHISES COMICS ANIME MOVIES TV GAMES MORE Join Our Team Newsletter Advertise With Us Log In Write For Us Home Contact Us Terms Privacy Copyright About Us Press Kit Find a Comic Shop Fact Checking Policy Corrections Policy Ethics Policy Ownership Policy Do Not Sell My Personal Information Copyright ¬© 2023 www.cbr.com AD AD AD AD AD AD Home Games 10 Retro Games with Active Competitive Scenes Worth Watching BY JOEY COLEMAN-ZAITZEFF PUBLISHED 6 DAYS AGO Titles like Tetris, StarCraft, and CounterStrike 1.6 may feel like relics of the past, but these games actually have thriving competitive communities. Gamers return to beloved retro classics for an abundance of reasons. Nostalgia transports fans to an earlier time while playing retro games, and trying out an old series today is an excellent way to appreciate classic titles. Revisiting retro games brings pieces of media history to the present, and their age gives them added meaning in the context of newer franchises. Fans of certain retro competitive games have been keeping the titles alive for decades. Fighting game classics and genre-defining strategy games alike maintain an active community of competitive play. Despite retro competitive games' age, players continue to discover new tactics and strategies. 10 Dated Nintendo Games That Are Still Fun 10 Age of Empires II Release Date 1999 Developer Ensemble Studios Publisher Microsoft Age of Empires II pits players against each other in medieval real-time strategy combat. Competitors start their empire as a few workers in the Dark Age and transform it into a thriving kingdom in the Empire Age. Managing resources, buildings, and manpower is essential for building an army powerful enough to conquer opponents. Age of Empires II allows players to choose from 45 different civilizations with their own unique bonuses, technologies, and units. Players can go head-to-head in 1v1s or team up in matches with up to 8 players in 4v4. Though the Age of Empires series has had numerous entries, Age of Empires II received an HD remake in 2012 as well as a remaster in the form of Age of Empires II: Definitive Edition in 2019. 9 Counter-Strike 1.6 Release Date 2000 Developer Valve Publisher Valve With Counter-Strike 2 just released, it may seem odd that the original Counter-Strike still has a competitive scene. Diehard fans continue to play Counter-Strike version 1.6, strafing and sneaking around classic maps like Dust and Inferno. Though casual play is almost non-existent, small teams around the globe maintain fan servers and set up competitions. Counter-Strike's competitive popularity is primarily due to its high skill ceiling and ability to run on limited hardware. Counter-Strike 1.6 can now run on basic computers and setting up a server for play is relatively easy. Because the game is now 23 years old, tips and guides on how to play are widely available. 8 Super Smash Bros. Melee Release Date 2001 Developer HAL Laboratories Publisher Nintendo Scary Retro Nintendo Levels To Revisit This Halloween Super Smash Bros. Melee, the sequel to the original Super Smash Bros., features quick and explosive combat with a roster filled with Nintendo's most iconic characters, like Link and Mario. Rather than depleting the opponent's health bar, attacks build up a damage percentage. The higher the damage percentage, the farther a character will fly when hit. The goal of each match is to knock opponents out of the stage. Since its release, grassroots Super Smash Bros. Melee tournaments have been a staple of the fighting game community. Though titles in the Smash Bros. series are commonly considered party games, there is a wealth of techniques and strategies to develop in competitive play. 7 StarCraft Release Date 1998 Developer Blizzard Entertainment Publisher Blizzard Entertainment The original StarCraft is legendary in the competitive gaming community. To this day, StarCraft is known for its finely tuned balance and its high level of competitive play. Players fight as one of three races, the technologically advanced Protoss, the hordes of insectoid Zerg, or the versatile human Terrans. Quick thinking and strategic planning must both be employed to overcome rival strategists. StarCraft was most popular in South Korea and much of the game's meta stems from the strategies developed by competitive Korean players. Today, StarCraft II reigns as the king of strategy games in eSports, but fans are still mastering the micromanagement of the first in the series. The original StarCraft is now free for those who want to experience one of the first eSports. 6 Heroes of Might and Magic III Release Date 1999 Developer New World Computing Publisher The 3DO Company Heroes of Might and Magic III remains one of the most expansive turn-based strategy games. The gameplay is split into three parts: Town development where players purchase buildings and combat units, map exploration where players send heroes to gather resources and engage in combat and tactical hex-based combat sequences where players command their armies against AI monsters or rival armies. Mastering all three sections allows the player to quickly build powerful armies and capture more towns. Heroes of Might and Magic III was a pioneer of online gaming, and--though the built-in online mechanics have not aged well--fan mods have kept the title alive since its release. The first-ever Heroes of Might and Magic III world tournament was held in January 2022 and the strategy classic maintains a substantial following on Twitch. Twelve differing factions and an endless number of maps ensure that every match plays out in its own unique way. 5 Pok√©mon Red, Blue and Yellow Release Date 1998 Developer Game Freak Publisher Nintendo 10 Things Pokemon Red And Blue Still Do Better Than The Rest Of The Series While the world of Pok√©mon has become ubiquitous, no iteration is better known than the original 151 Pok√©mon of Gen 1. Fans constantly debate the merits of the Pok√©mon sequels, reminiscing about the great creature design or the unique gameplay additions of a specific generation. Gen 1 has the most simplified mechanics, limiting the Pok√©mon pool, movesets, and types to those in the original entries to the series. The advent of the free web app Pok√©mon Showdown has made playing Gen 1 Pok√©mon easier than ever. Pok√©mon Showdown allows players to select and customize their teams automatically, foregoing the capturing and training in mainline Pok√©mon titles. Nostalgic fans can relive their dreams of being a Kanto Pok√©mon trainer while getting to know the mechanics of competitive Pok√©mon. 4 Super Mario Kart Release Date 1992 Developer Nintendo EAD Publisher Nintendo Super Mario spinoffs have truly taken lives of their own and the Mario Kart series is no exception. Super Mario Kart contains all the core DNA of the Mario Kart series: a roster of eight Mario characters race on one of 20 tracks, using battle items and driving skills to get ahead. The game's graphics used the SNES's Mode 7 to simulate 3D racing before polygonal graphics were widely available. The Super Mario Kart community continues to hold championships, not only for the standard racing mode but also for the game's item-based battle mode. For fans interested in the highest levels of play, online leaderboards post the world's fastest times for each track. Both types of competitive play demand intimate knowledge of every track and the game's retro driving controls. 3 The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past Release Date 1991 Developer Nintendo EAD Publisher Nintendo Best Storylines In The Legend Of Zelda Series, Ranked Fans adore The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past, not only for its lavish design or innovative mechanics but also for the way it captures the heart of the Zelda series. A Link to the Past blends the classic magical adventure of Zelda with wonderful pacing that thoughtfully introduces new mechanics and areas. The game also features the two parallel overworlds of the Light World and the Dark World, almost doubling the size of the initial map. The organization of dual overworlds, a plethora of dungeons, and numerous unlockable items make A Link to the Past a perfect candidate for a logic randomizer. The randomizer mixes up the location of items and randomly reorders the events of the game. In randomizer competitions, players try to complete the game the fastest through optimal gameplay and knowledge of the game's world. 2 Street Fighter II Turbo: Hyper Fighting Release Date 1992 Developer Capcom Publisher Capcom Even 30 years after the first Street Fighter game, competitive fighting game players are still returning to the smash arcade hit, Street Fighter II Turbo: Hyper Fighting. Street Fighter II introduced move combos and a roster of unique playable characters, tenets that would become central to the fighting game genre. The original arcade controls used an eight-directional joystick and six attack buttons, controls that can be replicated with a Fight Stick or mapped onto conventional controllers. The introduction of Turbo increased game speed and allowed players to attack and react quickly. This change kicked the competitive capacity of Street Fighter II into high gear because of the precise timing needed for combos and special moves. Fans and critics list Street Fighter II as one of the best games of all time, and it continues to be a standby at fighting game tournaments. 1 Tetris (NES) Release Date 1989 Developer Nintendo R&D1 (based on the original game created by Alexey Pajitnov) Publisher Nintendo Tetris remains one of the most iconic video games ever made due to its approachable gameplay. The classic real-time puzzle game keeps it simple: blocks of different shapes fall from the top of the screen and disappear when they are placed into a completed row. The speed at which blocks fall gets faster over time, and the game ends when the stack of blocks reaches the top of the screen, leaving players with their score based on how many rows they completed. Tournaments such as the Classic Tetris World Championship have been the source of many strategies and techniques for optimizing Tetris. One such technique called "rolling," where players tap the back of the controller into their fingers, has redefined the game. The current world record for NES Tetris is 6.4 million points. title: Speedway Motorsports taps Thor as RV partner
originBody: Wednesday, November 1, 2023Sign In SUBSCRIBE Menu Media Tech Executive Transactions Marketing All Topics Print Daily EditionsNewslettersWeekly Issue 10.30.2023 MARKETING AND SPONSORSHIP Speedway Motorsports taps Thor as RV partner BY ADAM STERN 10.30.2023 Speedway Motorsports has filled its official RV partner category with a new sponsor, as the publicly traded Thor Industries will promote its various brands at the promoter‚Äôs NASCAR tracks across America. The agreement was announced this morning heading into the final week of the 2023 NASCAR season. The track owner, controlled by the Smith family, is leveraging the massive amount of people who camp on their grounds annually during event weeks on an overall 25,000 camping spots. The deal includes marketing rights at all of SM‚Äôs 10 tracks plus Circuit of the Americas, which SM promotes NASCAR races at but doesn‚Äôt own. Thor plans to run campground promotions and sweepstakes, and provide on-site RV support. Indiana-based Thor owns 20 RV manufacturer brands like Airstream, Starcraft and Highland Ridge. Thor is entering the deal at a time when it is trying to boost business in the U.S., where its revenue and profit were down this year versus last year. The company was founded in 1980 and went public in 1984. Its name is a combination of the first two letters of the last names of company founders Wade Thompson and Peter Busch Orthwein. title: Shopify Rebellion head explains joining the LCS and ...
originBody: Register Sign in Gaming Entertainment TV & Movies Esports Tech More Call of Duty Pokemon Apex Legends Overwatch Valorant League of Legends EA SPORTS FC Fortnite Starfield Destiny Counter-Strike 2 Diablo Baldur's Gate Cyberpunk 2077 Zelda GTA Roblox Genshin Impact Honkai Star Rail CS:GO Mortal Kombat Minecraft World of Warcraft Rainbow Six All ESPORTS LEAGUE OF LEGENDS Shopify Rebellion head explains joining the LCS and partnering with Moist Declan Mclaughlin ‚ùò Published: Oct 26, 2023, 03:05 ‚ùò Updated: Oct 26, 2023, 03:05 SHOPIFY One of the heads of Shopify Rebellion spoke to Dexerto about purchasing TSM‚Äôs LCS slot, partnering with Moist Moguls in Valorant and the future of esports. Keep Watching Jacksepticeye claims MrBeast RUINED YouTube! 00:00/00:49 Shopify Rebellion made back-to-back blockbuster announcements on September 20. The Canadian e-commerce company‚Äôs esports division revealed their purchase of TSM‚Äôs former LCS slot and also showcased their partnership with influencer-lead Moist Esports in Valorant. The esports side of the public company has been competing in titles since 2021 and has a presence in Valorant, Rocket League, DOTA 2, Starcraft and Halo. However, the organization has not had a presence in League of Legends and is a new face to an LCS crowd. Shopify Rebellion‚Äôs Esports Program Development Lead Dario ‚ÄòTLO‚Äô W√ºnsch, spoke with Dexerto about entering the League of Legends space and how he plans to grow the brand in the LCS. TLO was a professional StarCraft player for Team Liquid, and he‚Äôs chosen to take his esports experience to Shopify Rebellion to try and create the next big esports org. And, considering that they‚Äôre entering the LCS in 2024 and working with Moist to take over the Valorant world, they‚Äôre kicking things into the next gear. Shopify Rebellion‚Äôs taking a chance on the LCS The organization is replacing arguably the most popular and one of the founding teams in the North American league, TSM. TLO told Dexerto that he is hoping to introduce the brand to the new esports community over time. ‚ÄúI think the scene is more focused on their own game, a little bit less cross-interest to other scenes. But certainly, over time that‚Äôs definitely the hope that this will create and garner more attention and that people more people will hopefully like what we‚Äôre doing,‚Äù the former StarCraft pro said. RELATED: Best free games to download & play on PC, PS5, Xbox, or Nintendo Switch We'll see you at the #LCS Arena in 2024. pic.twitter.com/9ZZAUmMEBA ‚Äî Shopify Rebellion (@ShopifyRebels) September 20, 2023 Unlike some other recent transactions in the League of Legends franchise system, TSM and Shopify have not disclosed how much the LCS slot costs. However, reports put the sale price at about $10 million, which is about as much money TSM spent to join the league back in 2018. While this and other metrics, like declining viewership, have scared off some of the business around esports, TLO isn‚Äôt convinced the LCS is a dying entity. ‚ÄúWe believe in the long term, potential and health of the property and that the way it‚Äôs perceived right now, and the market value that exists, is not representative of where we will be over the next decade. Generally, we believe in Riot Games‚Äô ecosystems very strongly,‚Äù he said. Shopify is already a mainstay in the Game Changers and Tier 2 level in Riot‚Äôs other major esport, Valorant. TLO also explained that this feels like the right time to jump into the esport for an org that isn‚Äôt too worried about next quarter‚Äôs earnings. While some orgs in the LCS are laying off people in the short term, Shopify can look ahead to 2028 and beyond. That doesn‚Äôt mean Shopify won‚Äôt try to be competitive right off the bat, or try to import expensive players in an attempt to make major tournaments quickly. However, it does mean that they have time to think through decisions longer than orgs that are strapped for cash and downsizing. SHOPIFY REBELLION Shopify Rebellion‚Äôs Halo team a the Fort Worth Major. ‚ÄúI feel sometimes teams and orgs get a little bit carried away by only pursuing a title and only being happy with a title. Obviously, that is the ultimate goal. But results are much less binary. You can be a very, very strong team and have a year you‚Äôre decently happy without necessarily taking home the trophy that year as well. So we look at it very in a nuanced way,‚Äù TLO said. Shopify Rebellion will also have the force of a public company in tow with its massive infrastructure. TLO said he is hoping to tap into the company‚Äôs marketing department for the LCS team and see what they can do to pull fans in. Subscribe to our newsletter for the latest updates on Esports, Gaming and more. Email Sign up Shopify Rebellion links up with Moist Esports Along with introducing itself to a new esports community, Shopify also had to explain its new venture in Valorant. The organization signed a main circuit Valorant team in 2022 and competed in the first year of the North American Challengers League. Going into the off-season, Shopify got to talking to the Moist Esports camp about trading players or finding other players homes and ended up coming out of it with a merged team and a joint venture, Moist x Shopify Rebellion. The two teams merged into one, only taking up one league spot, and the 10 players were consolidated into five. Showcasing Shopify‚Äôs structure and stability as an org combined with the reach and passion of Moist‚Äôs creator owners. Ludwig Aghren, a co-owner of the Moist brand, has already organized two showmatches for the new team during the off-season. We‚Äôre about to get wet with @MoistEsports üíßüíö Follow @MXSVALORANT for the roster reveal, coming in a hot minute üëÄ pic.twitter.com/UclZ5As81z ‚Äî Shopify Rebellion (@ShopifyRebels) September 20, 2023 Moist has its hands in other esports, some of the same ones as Shopify, but does not have a partnership like this in any other title. Right now, the arrangement is more of an experiment and ‚Äúcasual‚Äù according to TLO, as more serious legal structures could come depending on results during the season. ‚ÄúOnce you have ownership of a slot like that, things become a lot more serious,‚Äù he said when asked how the arrangement would work if the team earned a promotion in VCT Americas. Creator-led initiatives in esports are becoming more common as outside investment is harder to come by in the current economic climate. Orgs owned by content creators, like KOI and Karmine Corp, are also some of the more popular esports brands in their region and have broken into the same realm as traditional teams in the LEC. While not directly signing Ludwig, or his co-owner Charles ‚ÄòCr1TiKaL‚Äô White Jr., as creators, TLO has given Shopify more reach than it previously had in the esport, and beyond. The Shopify Rebellion head said the experiment is better than signing a celebrity, or creator, to attach to the esport who isn‚Äôt all that passionate about it to start with. CLOUD9 Moist x Shopify Rebellion and Cloud9‚Äôs Valorant teams after a showmatch. ‚ÄúA lot of teams have leaned heavily into trying to get influencers, and creators involved in some ways, but I think the problem so far has been that there was not enough genuine connection to it,‚Äù TLO said. The former Team Liquid player explained that some celebrities will interact with an esport or a team once, and then never really get involved at that level again. Prominent examples of this include Drake, who went viral for playing Fortnite with Ninja and has invested in 100 Thieves, and Snoop Dogg, who wore a FaZe Clan chain at the 2022 Super Bowl halftime show and was a part of the company‚Äôs board of directors. Both celebrities have not interacted with, or shown much interest, in esports since their initial dive into the space. ‚ÄúYou need to find people who are genuinely excited to be part of this and have some degree of ownership over it. So then you actually get real value out of it and people don‚Äôt just come over as fans of that celebrity,‚Äù the Shopify head said. SENTINELS Ludwig and tarik at the MxS vs. Sentinels showmatch. Shopify Rebellion is now in what looks to be a growth period after two years of juggling the responsibilities of a couple of different esports. The organization still needs time to build up staff for its new League team and will have to wait and see how its partnership pans out with Moist, but that doesn‚Äôt mean new things aren‚Äôt on the horizon. While orgs are downsizing, or going under, at a decent rate in North America, Shopify are moving in the opposite direction with a plan in mind. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think this is the end of the expansion, but we just want to make sure first we are fully set up until we consider the next step,‚Äù TLO said. originSummary: Shopify Rebellion has acquired TSM‚Äôs LCS slot for reportedly $10 million, showing their commitment to the value of LCS, even amid declining viewership and multiple businesses pulling away from the esport.
Alongside the purchase, Shopify Rebellion has formed a partnership with Moist Esports to establish a single Valorant team, expanding their esports endeavours.
Shopify Rebellion, the esports division of Shopify since 2021, operates teams across various games, including Valorant, Rocket League, DOTA 2, Starcraft, and Halo.

originSummary: Several video game platforms like Steam, Battle.net, Epic Games Store, and Prime Gaming are offering significant discounts, from 20% to 88% off, for Halloween 2023.
Noteworthy games on sale include Diablo 4, StarCraft 2, and Resident Evil 4, while some games, including Doom 3 and The Textorcist, are available for free on Prime Gaming within a certain timeframe.
Other platforms like the Humble Bundle store, PlayStation Halloween sale, and Ubisoft Store are also holding similar sales, with many popular games at discounted prices.

originSummary: The Municipality of Congonhas in Brazil is initiating various infrastructural and community health projects for resident welfare, including the construction of a gabion wall and creating a path between neighborhoods.

The city is campaigning to prevent the spread of dengue, chikungunya, and zika virus. Through the "Colorindo Congonhas" initiative, authorities are focusing on creating a vibrant living atmosphere. The health sector is battling Syphilis with regular tests and guidance.
Education resources are being improved for students and professionals, and the submission deadline for the Paulo Gustavo Law projects has been moved to November 8th.

originSummary: Cloud9, a significant organization in esports, has initiated a division for the real-time strategy game StarCraft II and enlisted Koh GuMiho ByeonJae, a seasoned player from Korea.
Since his start in 2010, GuMiho has earned over $290,000 from prizes, and in 2017, achieved the title of GSL Code S champion.
Koh is presently taking part in the 2023 Global StarCraft II League Season 3: Code S, with the announcement made via Cloud9's Twitter account.
